column4: halo anyone has idea how to remove the pending installation of some dependencies in ubuntu?
are you saying when in the GUI you cannot uninstall and packages
i installed something that has unmet deps
and now you cann remove it via term window or ubuntu package manager
aborted the installation and the deps keeps displaying via update manager but i want this to remove
did you try apt-get autoremove <package-name>
the package is not installed of course apt-get -f displays the deps but i want it to abort and clean
scriptwarlock:
did you try dropping down to recovery mode and delete using aptitude
using the apt-get autoremove it only displays unable to locate or couldn't find the package, of course i aborted the installation of that package
but a red dot on the top panel keeps displaying the pending deps of that to be installed package
Well I had issue similar issue and that what I did to get rid of the depends
run aptitude on safe mode?
reboot - hit the shift key - select recovery mode
be right back gonna try this on precise. i thought aptitude is dropped already
note a menus will appear when typing aptitude
thanks it's working but no need to go safe mode
of you types aptitude in a terminal window
yes and remove the aborted package
great
why can't we have that on a gui way
ah don't know
this is a recurring incident on aborted installation and that pesky pending deps will display
anyway big thanks
